intro: Myosotis scorpioides subsp. praecox, commonly known as early mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats such as meadows and ditches. It has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with a rough texture. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
